info.title: Google Cloud Deployment Manager API V2
info.description: The Deployment Manager API allows users to declaratively configure, deploy and run complex solutions on the Google Cloud Platform.

delete.description: ! Deletes a deployment and all of the resources in the deployment.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: ! The project ID for this request.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.description: ! The name of the deployment for this request.

get.description: ! Gets information about a specific deployment.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: ! The project ID for this request.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.description: ! The name of the deployment for this request.

post.description: ! Creates a deployment and all of the resources described by the ! deployment manifest.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: ! The project ID for this request.

get.description: ! Lists all deployments for a given project.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: ! The project ID for this request.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: ! Maximum count of results to be returned. ! Acceptable values are 0 to 100, inclusive. (Default: 50)

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: ! Specifies a nextPageToken returned by a previous list request. This ! token can be used to request the next page of results from a previous ! list request.

get.description: ! Lists all Types for Deployment Manager.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: ! The project ID for this request.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: ! Maximum count of results to be returned. ! Acceptable values are 0 to 100, inclusive. (Default: 50)

parameters.description: ! Specifies a nextPageToken returned by a previous list request. This ! token can be used to request the next page of results from a previous ! list request.

description.description: ! An optional user-provided description of the deployment.

id.description: [Output Only] Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server.

manifest.description: ! [Output Only] URL of the manifest representing the full configuration ! of this deployment.

name.description: ! The name of the deployment, which must be unique within the project.

targetConfig.description: ! [Input Only] The YAML configuration to use in processing this deployment. ! ! When you create a deployment, the server creates a new manifest with the ! given YAML configuration and sets the `manifest` property to the URL of ! the manifest resource.

DeploymentsListResponse.description: ! A response containing a partial list of deployments and a page token used ! to build the next request if the request has been truncated. Next available tag: 4

deployments.description: ! The deployments contained in this response.

nextPageToken.description: ! A token used to continue a truncated list request.

config.description: v2beta1: YAML with config - described above v2beta2: YAML + templates. ! The YAML configuration for this manifest.

evaluatedConfig.description: ! [Output Only] The fully-expanded configuration file, including any ! templates and references.

id.description: [Output Only] Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server.

name.description: ! [Output Only] The name of the manifest.

selfLink.description: [Output Only] Self link for the manifest.

ManifestsListResponse.description: ! A response containing a partial list of manifests and a page token used ! to build the next request if the request has been truncated. Next available tag: 4

manifests.description: ! Manifests contained in this list response.

nextPageToken.description: ! A token used to continue a truncated list request.

Operation.description: ! An operation resource, used to manage asynchronous API requests. Next available tag: 24

creationTimestamp.description: ! [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

endTime.description: ! [Output Only] The time that this operation was completed. This is in ! RFC3339 format.

error.description: ! [Output Only] If errors occurred during processing of this operation, ! this field will be populated.

errors.description: ! The array of errors encountered while processing this operation.

code.description: ! The error type identifier for this error.

location.description: ! Indicates the field in the request which caused the error. ! This property is optional.

httpErrorMessage.description: ! [Output Only] If operation fails, the HTTP error message returned, ! e.g. NOT FOUND.

httpErrorStatusCode.description: ! [Output Only] If operation fails, the HTTP error status code returned, ! e.g. 404.

id.description: ! [Output Only] Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server.

insertTime.description: ! [Output Only] The time that this operation was requested. ! This is in RFC 3339 format.

operationType.description: ! [Output Only] Type of the operation. Examples include "insert", or ! "delete"

progress.description: ! [Output Only] An optional progress indicator that ranges from 0 to 100. ! There is no requirement that this be linear or support any granularity ! of operations. This should not be used to guess at when the operation will ! be complete. This number should be monotonically increasing as the ! operation progresses.

selfLink.description: [Output Only] Self link for the manifest.

startTime.description: ! [Output Only] The time that this operation was started by the server. ! This is in RFC 3339 format.

status.description: ! [Output Only] Status of the operation. Can be one of the following: ! "PENDING", "RUNNING", or "DONE".

statusMessage.description: ! [Output Only] An optional textual description of the current status of ! the operation.

targetId.description: ! [Output Only] Unique target id which identifies a particular ! incarnation of the target.

targetLink.description: ! [Output Only] URL of the resource the operation is mutating.

user.description: ! [Output Only] User who requested the operation, for example ! "user@example.com"

warnings.description: ! [Output Only] If warning messages generated during processing of this ! operation, this field will be populated.

code.description: ! The warning type identifier for this warning.

data.description: ! Metadata for this warning in 'key: value' format.

key.description: ! A key for the warning data.

value.description: ! A warning data value corresponding to the key.

message.description: ! Optional human-readable details for this warning.

OperationsListResponse.description: ! A response containing a partial list of operations and a page token used ! to build the next request if the request has been truncated. Next available tag: 4

nextPageToken.description: ! A token used to continue a truncated list request.

operations.description: ! Operations contained in this list response.

errors.description: ! [Output Only] A list of any errors that occurred during deployment.

id.description: [Output Only] Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server.

intent.description: ! [Output Only] The intended state of the resource.

manifest.description: ! [Output Only] URL of the manifest representing the current configuration ! of this resource.

name.description: ! [Output Only] The name of the resource as it appears in the YAML config.

state.description: ! [Output Only] The state of the resource.

type.description: ! [Output Only] The type of the resource, for example ! ?compute.v1.instance?, or ?replicaPools.v1beta2.instanceGroupManager?

url.description: ! [Output Only] The URL of the actual resource.

ResourcesListResponse.description: ! A response containing a partial list of resources and a page token used ! to build the next request if the request has been truncated. Next available tag: 4

nextPageToken.description: ! A token used to continue a truncated list request.

resources.description: ! Resources contained in this list response.

Type.description: ! A type supported by Deployment Manager. Next available tag: 4

TypesListResponse.description: ! A response that returns all Types supported by Deployment Manager Next available tag: 3

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.name: key
key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.name: oauth_token
oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint
prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.name: quotaUser
quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.name: userIp
userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services
scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ndev.clo: View and manage your Google Cloud Platform management resources and deployment status information
View your Google Cloud Platform management resources and deployment status information
